thread.title: Rain in J&K, Himachal Pradesh LIVE: IMD issues red alert for three districts in Himachal Pradesh - The Hindu
thread.title_full: Rain in J&K, Himachal Pradesh LIVE: IMD issues red alert for three districts in Himachal Pradesh - The Hindu

author: The Hindu Bureau
title: Rain in J&K, Himachal Pradesh LIVE: IMD issues red alert for three districts in Himachal Pradesh - The Hindu
text:
Key Updates Traffic diversions on NH44 after heavy rains damage Nagpur Highway Flooding disrupts routine life in Prayagraj and Varanasi Is torrential rainfall our new normal? August 28, 2025 19:27 Punjab floods: Central, State agencies working tirelessly to conduct rescue operations With at least eight districts of Punjab remaining under the grip of massive floods, various central agencies in coordination with State authorities have been working tirelessly for the past four days to evacuate stranded people from inundated areas.
Following the requests by the district administrations, the Army, Border Security Force, Indian Air Force and National Disaster Response Force have swiftly responded to the crisis situation and are undertaking large-scale rescue operations, said officials.
They are undertaking these operations in close cooperation with the State Disaster Response Force, Punjab Police and district administration officials.
-PTI
August 28, 2025 18:31 Landslides, waterlogging in parts of Kerala due to heavy rains; orange alert in 6 districts Rains intensified in Kerala, causing waterlogging, a rise in water levels of dams and landslides in some parts of the State, with the IMD issuing an orange alert in six districts for the day.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an orange alert in Ernakulam, Thrissur, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasaragod districts of the State.
It also issued a yellow alert in five districts -- Pathanamthitta, Idukki, Palakkad and Malappuram -- for the day.
An orange alert means very heavy rain of 11 cm to 20 cm, and a yellow alert means heavy rainfall between 6 cm and 11 cm.
-PTI
August 28, 2025 17:51 Telangana CM inspects Yellampally project; targets BRS on Kaleshwaram barrages To monitor the flood situation in North Telangana, Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy visited the Sripada Yellampally project along with Irrigation Minister N. Uttam Kumar Reddy, TPCC president Mahesh Goud, and Ramagundam MLA Makkan Singh Thakur, and used the occasion to target former Chief Minister K. Chandrashekhar Rao linking him to the ‘poor’ construction of the Kaleshwaram project.
Read more here August 28, 2025 17:09 Chhattisgarh’s Bastar floods leave 8 dead, CM directs officials to extend help Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai directs officials to extend all possible assistance to families affected by floods in the Bastar division, where eight persons have been killed.
Mr. Sai, currently on a visit to South Korea, held a video conference with the senior official and collectors of flood-hit Bastar, Dantewada, Bijapur and Sukma districts and reviewed the relief and rehabilitation measures, a government statement adds.
Revenue Minister Tank Ram Verma confirms that the floods has claimed eight lives, killed 96 livestock, damaged around 495 houses and 16 culverts and bridges in these districts.
More than 2,000 people have been evacuated to safety after incessant rains over the past three days triggered flash floods, inundating vast areas in the region and disrupting normal life, an official had said on Wednesday.
-PTI
August 28, 2025 15:47 Chamoli Police issue traffic advisory following blockage of Joshimath-Malari road route The Chamoli Police on Thursday (August 28, 2025) issued a traffic advisory informing about the blockage of Joshimath-Malari road route due to debris falling before Surai Thota.
Continuous work is being done to remove the debris using JCB machines on the route, and the route is expected to open by evening.
“The Joshimath-Malari road route has been blocked due to debris falling before Surai Thota. Continuous work is being done to remove the debris using JCB machines on the route, and the route is expected to open by evening,” Chamoli Police wrote on ‘X’.
The Uttarakhand government is continuously sending rations and essential relief material to the areas affected by the August 5 landslides and flash floods in Dharali and Harshil areas of Uttarakashi district, said officials.
The Uttarkashi district administration told ANI that, following the Dharali-Harsil natural disaster, the administration has been continuously sending rations and essential relief materials to the affected areas through MI-17 from Chinyalisaur airstrip and helicopters from Matli helipad.
August 28, 2025 15:17 Flood threat returns to Uttar Pradesh; Prayagraj, Varanasi, Muzaffarnagar worst affected ​ ​
August 28, 2025 15:08 Rising Ganga floods Varanasi ghats; ‘aarti’, cremations being held on rooftops With water level in the Ganga river rising steadily, normal activities on the ghats of Varanasi have been disrupted, including the ‘aarti’ ritual and cremations, officials said on Thursday (August 28, 2025).
After a slight decrease in the past few days, the water level is rising again and on Thursday (August 28, 2025) morning, it crossed the warning mark of 70.262 metres to reach 70.91 metres, nearing the danger level at 71.262 metres, they said.
Prayagraj: People on a boat in a waterlogged area as the water level of the Ganga river rises following heavy rainfall, in Prayagraj, Thursday, Aug. 28, 2025. (PTI Photo)(PTI08_28_2025_000111B)
